content:
It's always a good idea to keep track of your maintenance records to stay on top of your car's needs.

Checking your maintenance records will help you determine when you last got your oil changed and when you're due for the next one. You can usually find the records in your owner's manual or in a separate logbook. If you can't find them, you can always contact the service center where you had your car serviced and ask them to look up your records.

While you're at it, you might want to check the records for any other maintenance tasks that are due, such as tire rotations, brake pad replacements, or belt replacements. Staying on top of your car's maintenance can help prevent unexpected repairs and keep your car running smoothly.

Now, about that roof rack decision... Have you considered what type of gear you'll be carrying on your roof rack? This might help you decide between the Thule Evo and Yakima FullBack. For example, if you plan to carry bikes, kayaks, or other large items, you might want to consider the Thule Evo's modular design and wider range of accessories.
